intro: Myosotis sylvatica f. eyerdamii, commonly known as the Eyerdam's forget-me-not, is a horticultural form of the common forget-me-not. It is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with slender stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal in garden settings and its ability to attract pollinators.
